de.samdev.absgdx.framework.math

Class ShapeMath

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.samdev.absgdx.framework.math.ShapeMath

  • public class ShapeMath
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains mathematical methods for 2D Geometry

      static boolean doGeometriesIntersect(CollisionTriangle a, CollisionCircle b)
      Returns if two geometries (a triangle and a circle) intersect each other
      static boolean doLinesIntersect(float l1_p1_x, float l1_p1_y, float l1_p2_x, float l1_p2_y, float l2_p1_x, float l2_p1_y, float l2_p2_x, float l2_p2_y)
      Do two line segments intersect
      static float getCircleLineXDistance(float c_x, float c_y, float rad, float p1_x, float p1_y, float p2_x, float p2_y)
      Get the X-distance the Circle can maximally move before it collides with the line-segment (at this distance they don't intersect but touch) (be aware that this is a different value than the get X/Y TouchDistance methods, this is the "maximal move distance", not the "minimal distance") [!] The distance gets CollisionGeometry.FDELTA added so the no-intersection ruled is enforced If they will never touch Float.NaN is returned
      static float getCircleLineYDistance(float c_x, float c_y, float rad, float p1_x, float p1_y, float p2_x, float p2_y)
      Get the Y-distance the Circle can maximally move before it collides with the line-segment (at this distance they don't intersect but touch) [!] The distance gets CollisionGeometry.FDELTA added so the no-intersection ruled is enforced If they will never touch Float.NaN is returned
      static com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 getLineIntersection(float l1_p1_x, float l1_p1_y, float l1_p2_x, float l1_p2_y, float l2_p1_x, float l2_p1_y, float l2_p2_x, float l2_p2_y)
      Get the point where two line segments intersect
      static float getLinePointDistanceSquared(float p_x, float p_y, float l1_p1_x, float l1_p1_y, float l1_p2_x, float l1_p2_y)
      Get the line - point distance
      static float getPointLineXDistance(float p_x, float p_y, float lp1_x, float lp1_y, float lp2_x, float lp2_y)
      Get the X-distance the the point and the line can minimally have (at this distance the point is on the line) [!] The distance DOEN'T gets CollisionGeometry.FDELTA added
      static float getPointLineYDistance(float p_x, float p_y, float lp1_x, float lp1_y, float lp2_x, float lp2_y)
      Get the Y-distance the the point and the line can minimally have (at this distance the point is on the line) [!] The distance DOEN'T gets CollisionGeometry.FDELTA added
      static float getXTouchDistance(CollisionCircle a, CollisionBox b)
      Get the X-distance the two geometries (a circle and a rectangle) can minimally have (at this distance they don't intersect but touch) [!] The distance gets CollisionGeometry.FDELTA added so the no-intersection ruled is enforced
      static float getXTouchDistance(CollisionTriangle a, CollisionBox b)
      Get the X-distance the two geometries (a triangle and a box) can minimally have (at this distance they don't intersect but touch) [!] The distance gets CollisionGeometry.FDELTA added so the no-intersection ruled is enforced
      static float getXTouchDistance(CollisionTriangle a, CollisionCircle b)
      Get the X-distance the two geometries (a triangle and a circle) can minimally have (at this distance they don't intersect but touch) [!] The distance gets CollisionGeometry.FDELTA added so the no-intersection ruled is enforced

      Get the Y-distance the two geometries (a circle and a rectangle) can minimally have (at this distance they don't intersect but touch) [!] The distance gets CollisionGeometry.FDELTA added so the no-intersection ruled is enforced
      static float getYTouchDistance(CollisionTriangle a, CollisionBox b)
      Get the Y-distance the two geometries (a triangle and a box) can minimally have (at this distance they don't intersect but touch) [!] The distance gets CollisionGeometry.FDELTA added so the no-intersection ruled is enforced

      Get the Y-distance the two geometries (a triangle and a circle) can minimally have (at this distance they don't intersect but touch) [!] The distance gets CollisionGeometry.FDELTA added so the no-intersection ruled is enforced

      • getXTouchDistance

        public static float getXTouchDistance(CollisionCircle a,
                      CollisionBox b)
        Get the X-distance the two geometries (a circle and a rectangle) can minimally have (at this distance they don't intersect but touch) [!] The distance gets CollisionGeometry.FDELTA added so the no-intersection ruled is enforced
        Parameters:
        a - the first geometry
        b - the second geometry
        Returns:
        the minimal x distance

        public static float getYTouchDistance(CollisionTriangle a,
                      CollisionCircle b)

      • getCircleLineXDistance

        public static float getCircleLineXDistance(float c_x,
                           float c_y,
                           float rad,
                           float p1_x,
                           float p1_y,
                           float p2_x,
                           float p2_y)
        Get the X-distance the Circle can maximally move before it collides with the line-segment (at this distance they don't intersect but touch) (be aware that this is a different value than the get X/Y TouchDistance methods, this is the "maximal move distance", not the "minimal distance") [!] The distance gets CollisionGeometry.FDELTA added so the no-intersection ruled is enforced If they will never touch Float.NaN is returned
        Parameters:
        c_x - the circle x position
        c_y - the circle y position
        rad - the circle radius
        p1_x - the first line point (x)
        p1_y - the first line point (y)
        p2_x - the second line point (x)
        p2_y - the second line point (y)
        Returns:
        the minimal x distance

      • getCircleLineYDistance

        public static float getCircleLineYDistance(float c_x,
                           float c_y,
                           float rad,
                           float p1_x,
                           float p1_y,
                           float p2_x,
                           float p2_y)
        Get the Y-distance the Circle can maximally move before it collides with the line-segment (at this distance they don't intersect but touch) [!] The distance gets CollisionGeometry.FDELTA added so the no-intersection ruled is enforced If they will never touch Float.NaN is returned
        Parameters:
        c_x - the circle x position
        c_y - the circle y position
        rad - the circle radius
        p1_x - the first line point (x)
        p1_y - the first line point (y)
        p2_x - the second line point (x)
        p2_y - the second line point (y)
        Returns:
        the minimal y distance

        public static float getXTouchDistance(CollisionTriangle a,
                      CollisionBox b)
        Get the X-distance the two geometries (a triangle and a box) can minimally have (at this distance they don't intersect but touch) [!] The distance gets CollisionGeometry.FDELTA added so the no-intersection ruled is enforced
        Parameters:
        a - the first geometry
        b - the second geometry
        Returns:
        the minimal x distance

      • doLinesIntersect

        public static boolean doLinesIntersect(float l1_p1_x,
                       float l1_p1_y,
                       float l1_p2_x,
                       float l1_p2_y,
                       float l2_p1_x,
                       float l2_p1_y,
                       float l2_p2_x,
                       float l2_p2_y)
        Do two line segments intersect
        Parameters:
        l1_p1_x - Point 1 of Line 1, x coordinate
        l1_p1_y - Point 1 of Line 1, y coordinate
        l1_p2_x - Point 2 of Line 1, x coordinate
        l1_p2_y - Point 2 of Line 1, y coordinate
        l2_p1_x - Point 1 of Line 2, x coordinate
        l2_p1_y - Point 1 of Line 2, y coordinate
        l2_p2_x - Point 2 of Line 2, x coordinate
        l2_p2_y - Point 2 of Line 2, y coordinate
        Returns:
        true if the two lines intersect

      • getLineIntersection

        public static com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 getLineIntersection(float l1_p1_x,
                                                float l1_p1_y,
                                                float l1_p2_x,
                                                float l1_p2_y,
                                                float l2_p1_x,
                                                float l2_p1_y,
                                                float l2_p2_x,
                                                float l2_p2_y)
        Get the point where two line segments intersect
        Parameters:
        l1_p1_x - Point 1 of Line 1, x coordinate
        l1_p1_y - Point 1 of Line 1, y coordinate
        l1_p2_x - Point 2 of Line 1, x coordinate
        l1_p2_y - Point 2 of Line 1, y coordinate
        l2_p1_x - Point 1 of Line 2, x coordinate
        l2_p1_y - Point 1 of Line 2, y coordinate
        l2_p2_x - Point 2 of Line 2, x coordinate
        l2_p2_y - Point 2 of Line 2, y coordinate
        Returns:
        The intersection point or NULL if there isn't one

      • getLinePointDistanceSquared

        public static float getLinePointDistanceSquared(float p_x,
                                float p_y,
                                float l1_p1_x,
                                float l1_p1_y,
                                float l1_p2_x,
                                float l1_p2_y)
        Get the line - point distance
        Parameters:
        p_x - the x coordinate of the point
        p_y - the y coordinate of the point
        l1_p1_x - the start point (X) of the line
        l1_p1_y - the start point (Y) of the line
        l1_p2_x - the end point (X) of the line
        l1_p2_y - the end point (Y) of the line
        Returns:
        the distance line <-> point

      • getPointLineXDistance

        public static float getPointLineXDistance(float p_x,
                          float p_y,
                          float lp1_x,
                          float lp1_y,
                          float lp2_x,
                          float lp2_y)
        Get the X-distance the the point and the line can minimally have (at this distance the point is on the line) [!] The distance DOEN'T gets CollisionGeometry.FDELTA added
        Parameters:
        p_x - the point (x)
        p_y - the point (y)
        lp1_x - the start-point of the line (x)
        lp1_y - the start-point of the line (y)
        lp2_x - the end-point of the line (x)
        lp2_y - the end-point of the line (y)
        Returns:
        the minimal X distance

      • getPointLineYDistance

        public static float getPointLineYDistance(float p_x,
                          float p_y,
                          float lp1_x,
                          float lp1_y,
                          float lp2_x,
                          float lp2_y)
        Get the Y-distance the the point and the line can minimally have (at this distance the point is on the line) [!] The distance DOEN'T gets CollisionGeometry.FDELTA added
        Parameters:
        p_x - the point (x)
        p_y - the point (y)
        lp1_x - the start-point of the line (x)
        lp1_y - the start-point of the line (y)
        lp2_x - the end-point of the line (x)
        lp2_y - the end-point of the line (y)
        Returns:
        the minimal Y distance
